column4: Ok, so I don't even think I'm asking the right question, so feel free to point me in a diffrent direction. I want a script to run, after the install of ubuntu is complete and it boots for the first time. Can someone point me in the direction of what I'm looking for?
On first boot only, or on every boot?
So you're making a custom install image... Umm... Humm.  I know RHEL has a firstboot package for that... maybe if you look at the ubuntu OEM install?  That may be the way...
